content: upd 06 26 2021 i am pleased to publish a description for the mosaic crochet overlay technique description for crocheting in the round or from bottom to top lots of photos verbal description for each row and links to videos the potholder #1 a total of 51g color a scheepjes skies 24g 40 8 m/ approx 44¾ yds color b scheepjes bloom 27g 43 2 m/ approx 47¼yds the potholder #2 a total of 48g color a scheepjes bloom 26g 41 6 m/ approx 45½yds color b scheepjes skies 22g 37 4 m/ approx 41 yds the potholder #3 a total of 46g color a scheepjes bloom 24g 38 4 m/ approx 47¼yds color b scheepjes skies 22g 37 4 m/ approx 41 yds hook size 3 75 mm the size of the potholder is 19 by 19 cm app 7½″ by 7½″ technique double filet crochet interlocking filet crochet with diagonals worked in the round skill level advanced hook size 4 mm the size of the potholder is 18 by 18 cm app 7″ by 7″ the pattern contains a graph and right-handed instructions i crocheted the potholders with four strands of cotton yarn 600m/100g on potholders # 1 and # 3 i replaced one thread at a time with a thread of a different color and i got a gradient for one potholder you need a total of 55g of yarn about 25g 37 5m / 41 yds for crocheting without diagonals and 30g 45 m / 49 ¼ yds for crocheting with diagonals it is better if you have a small amount of extra yarn since yarn consumption depends on a persons gauge many thanks to all testers i managed to make the description much better they did an amazing job testing my patterns i m so excited to share this pattern with you please do share your progress with me have fun svetlana
